intro: Ochrocarpos obovalis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ochrocarpus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
